1: <sup>1</sup> O come, let us sing unto the LORD: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
2: <sup>2</sup> Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.
3: <sup>3</sup> For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
4: <sup>4</sup> In his hand are the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills is his also.
5: <sup>5</sup> The sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.
6: <sup>6</sup> O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the LORD our maker.
7: <sup>7</sup> For he is our God; and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,
8: <sup>8</sup> Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
9: <sup>9</sup> When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.
10: <sup>10</sup> Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said, It is a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:
11: <sup>11</sup> Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.
